pageContext.claim: “We’ll have three quarters in a row over 3[percent].  We had 3.2, and a lot of people thought it would take two or three years to get there.  And we’re going to be hitting 4 soon, and then we’re going to be hitting 5’s.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. Quarterly GDP growth topped 3 percent often in Barack Obama's presidency, mostly recently 2015. Trump has pledged 4 percent annual growth, which most economists think is unlikely.
